abstract.text: Generates a platform-native image from the web view’s contents asynchronously.

inlineContent.text: The object that specifies the portion of the web view to capture, and other capture-related behaviors.
The completion handler to call when the image is ready. This block has no return value and takes the following parameters:
A platform-native image that contains the specified portion of the web view.
An error object if a problem occurred, or
You can call this method from synchronous code using a completion handler, as shown on this page, or you can call it as an asynchronous method that has the following declaration:

code: func takeSnapshot(configuration snapshotConfiguration: WKSnapshotConfiguration?) async throws -> UIImage

inlineContent.text: For information about concurrency and asynchronous code in Swift, see

abstract.text: Learn how functions and methods that take a completion handler are converted to Swift asynchronous functions.
Integrate web content seamlessly into your app, and customize content interactions to meet your app’s needs.
The configuration data to use when generating a PDF representation of a web view’s contents.
The configuration data to use when generating an image from a web view’s contents.
An object that displays interactive web content, such as for an in-app browser.
Generates PDF data from the web view’s contents asynchronously.
Generates PDF data from the web view’s contents asynchronously.
Creates a web archive of the web view’s current contents asynchronously.
Creates a web archive of the web view’s contents asynchronously.
Generates PDF data from the web view’s contents asynchronously.
Returns the print operation object to use when printing the contents of the web view.
Generates a platform-native image from the web view’s contents asynchronously.
A high-level interface for manipulating image data.
An object that manages image data in your app.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
